revised_title: Magnetism in Hot-Rolled and Cold-Rolled Iron: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author conducted experiments to compare the magnetic properties of hot-rolled and cold-rolled malleable iron. The results showed that cold-rolled iron receives and retains a greater amount of induced magnetism than hot-rolled iron. Hot-rolled iron tends to retain its primitive magnetism better than cold-rolled iron. The study provides insights into the magnetic properties of iron and its potential applications in various industries.
